intro: Syncolostemon qudeniensis, commonly known as the Sudanese thornbush, is a shrub native to the arid regions of Sudan. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, woolly leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils and can tolerate high temperatures and limited water availability. Syncolostemon qudeniensis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for local wildlife in its native environment.
